name: Major Historical Events
description: Learn about key historical events that shaped our world

cards.front: The Fall of the Berlin Wall
cards.back: November 9, 1989 - The physical barrier between East and West Berlin was opened, symbolically ending the Cold War.
July 20, 1969 - Neil Armstrong became the first human to step onto the lunar surface.

cards.front: Invention of the World Wide Web
cards.back: 1989 - Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web while at CERN, revolutionizing information sharing globally.
Late 1700s to early 1800s - Transition to new manufacturing processes in Europe and the United States.
1928 - Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin, the first true antibiotic, revolutionizing medicine.
Around 1440 - Johannes Gutenberg invented the movable-type printing press, enabling mass communication.
July 4, 1776 - The Continental Congress declared the thirteen American colonies as independent sovereign states.
1789-1799 - A period of radical social and political upheaval in France with impacts throughout Europe.

cards.front: The End of World War II
cards.back: September 2, 1945 - Japan formally surrendered, ending the deadliest conflict in human history.
March 10, 1876 - Alexander Graham Bell made the first successful telephone call.
